Action and Turn Management.name: Action Points
Action and Turn Management.description: Players have a limited number of points to perform actions each turn.
requirements: Define the number of action points per turn.
Specify actions and their costs in points.
Rules for unused action points (carryover or loss).

Action and Turn Management.name: Simultaneous Action Selection
Action and Turn Management.description: Players secretly select and reveal actions at the same time.
requirements: Provide a method for secret selection (e.g., cards, tokens).
Define rules for resolving conflicts if actions overlap.
Specify timing or sequencing rules for revealed actions.

Card Play.name: Card Play / Deck Building
Card Play.description: Cards represent resources, actions, or events. Players build a deck over time and draw cards to execute strategies.
requirements: Define card types (action, item, etc.).
Rules for deck composition and usage.
Mechanics for card acquisition and discard.
Define maximum hand size and draw mechanics.

Card Play.name: Hand Management
Card Play.description: Players manage a limited number of cards to maximize efficiency.
requirements: Define maximum hand size.
Specify how cards are drawn and discarded.
Establish rules for card effects and timing of play.

Dice and Randomness.name: Dice Rolling
Dice and Randomness.description: Used for movement, combat, or random events.
requirements: Define outcomes for each face of the dice.
Provide rules for interpreting dice results.
Balance between randomness and player agency.
Specify modifiers or reroll mechanics (if any).

Player Interaction.name: Hidden Roles
Player Interaction.description: Players have secret objectives or affiliations.
requirements: Role distribution and victory conditions for each role.
Mechanics for revealing or deducing roles.
Rules for handling secret information and actions.

Player Interaction.name: Negotiation
Player Interaction.description: Players form temporary alliances or trade resources.
requirements: Define the scope of allowed negotiation (e.g., resources, alliances).
Rules for breaking alliances or renegotiation.
Provide a mechanism for formalizing agreements if needed.

Progression and Development.name: Tech Trees / Tracks
Progression and Development.description: Players unlock abilities or upgrades over time.
requirements: Define a clear progression path or tree.
Specify costs or requirements for each upgrade.
Rules for simultaneous upgrades by multiple players.

Progression and Development.name: Legacy Mechanics
Progression and Development.description: Persistent changes to the game state between sessions.
requirements: Define mechanics for tracking game state changes.
Provide components to record persistent effects (e.g., stickers, cards).
Rules for integrating legacy mechanics into gameplay.

Resource and Area Management.name: Worker Placement
Resource and Area Management.description: Assign workers to tasks or areas for resources.
requirements: Define areas or tasks available for placement.
Rules for resource allocation based on worker placement.
Specify limits on worker placement per area.

Resource and Area Management.name: Area Control / Majority
Resource and Area Management.description: Compete for dominance in specific regions.
requirements: Define regions and their control conditions.
Rules for resolving ties in dominance.
Mechanics for gaining or losing control of regions.
